intro: Linanthus pungens subsp. hookeri, commonly known as Hooker's linanthus, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes mallows and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its slender stems, hairy leaves, and showy yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. This subspecies is often found in open grasslands and along streambanks in California and Nevada.
